title: Military Look Font
content:
Hi guys,  
Any idea which is this font?  
If you can find free alternatives for this one that would be great. I need to make a quick mockup for a maybe job and that would be perfect.

Regards,

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Captura de pantalla 2014-05-13 a la(s) 23.37.48.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20140824153912/http:/typophile.com/files/Captura%20de%20pantalla%202014-05-13%20a%20la(s)%2023.37.48.png) | 52.65 KB |
author: uzapucax

comments.content:
Looks like House Industries United Italic Semi Condensed Black

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140824153912im_/http:/typophile.com/files/bags1_5796.jpg)
Doesn't look like it's free.
Thanks Dpape for the info. Any alternative to this one for free. I just need a mockup to convey that aesthetics. Best,

You can use a manually slanted **[JD Erica](http://web.archive.org/web/20140824153912/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Dafont-1&ffam=JD%20Erica%20-%20Regular&fid=1f781d685949c7f9dff8e0e333a24afe&fstyle=i&fsize=60&text=BAGS%20%26%20PACKS&fit=1)** free font by Jecko Development [2011] for the mockup.  
Note though that /A & /K glyphs are a lot different than your initial sample

Previous discussions on similar topics, some suggestions are free: [http://typophile.com/node/80172#comment-456346](http://web.archive.org/web/20140824153912/http:/typophile.com/node/80172#comment-456346 "http://typophile.com/node/80172#comment-456346"), [http://typophile.com/node/105488#comment-562631](http://web.archive.org/web/20140824153912/http:/typophile.com/node/105488#comment-562631 "http://typophile.com/node/105488#comment-562631"), [http://typophile.com/node/100891#comment-544830](http://web.archive.org/web/20140824153912/http:/typophile.com/node/100891#comment-544830 "http://typophile.com/node/100891#comment-544830"), [http://typophile.com/node/102317#comment-551078](http://web.archive.org/web/20140824153912/http:/typophile.com/node/102317#comment-551078 "http://typophile.com/node/102317#comment-551078")

thanks guys! both tips and links were very useful to me.

Best,  
S
